articles.title: Roundtables: Why 2026 Is the Year for Sodium-Ion Batteries
articles.summary: Listen to the session or watch below Sodium-based batteries could be a cheaper, safer alternative to lithium-ion, and the technology is finally making its way into cars—and energy storage arrays on the grid. Sodium-ion batteries are one of MIT Technology Review’s 10 Breakthrough Technologies of 2026

articles.title: Listen to Earth’s rumbling, secret soundtrack
articles.summary: The boom of a calving glacier. The crackling rumble of a wildfire. The roar of a surging storm front. They’re the noises of the living Earth, music of this one particular sphere and clues to the true nature of these dramatic events. But as loud as all these things are, they emit even more acoustic…

articles.title: Disrupting malicious uses of AI | February 2026
articles.summary: Our latest threat report examines how malicious actors combine AI models with websites and social platforms—and what it means for detection and defense.

articles.title: Why we no longer evaluate SWE-bench Verified
articles.summary: SWE-bench Verified is increasingly contaminated and mismeasures frontier coding progress. Our analysis shows flawed tests and training leakage. We recommend SWE-bench Pro.
